item.title: Remembering the Klondike Hotel & Casino: A Vintage Vegas Landmark
item.description:
A Humble Start: From Kona Kai to Klondike

Before the mega-resorts and dazzling fountains, the Las Vegas Strip was a different beast. Situated prominently between the iconic “Welcome to Fabulous Las Vegas” sign and the then-newly-built McCarran International Airport, the Klondike Hotel and Casino held a unique spot in that history. It began its life in 1962 as the Kona Kai Motel, a modest roadside stop catering to travelers passing through. It wasn’t a glamorous beginning, but it was the foundation for what would become a beloved local institution.
